dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Mark Zuckerberg's push into cryptocurrency is just the tip of the iceberg—this goes all the way back to Satoshi Nakamoto embedding that Times headline in the Genesis block.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Mark Zuckerberg's push into cryptocurrency is just the tip of the iceberg-this goes all the way back to Satoshi Nakamoto embedding that Times headline in the Genesis block.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Buried within the code of his Genesis block, Nakamoto embedded a reminder of what happens when too much trust is placed in banks. It was a headline from a British newspaper announcing the imminent bailout of the financial institutions following their collapse in 2008 and 2009: The Times 03/Jan/2009 Chancellor On Brink of Second Bailout for Banks.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, that 2009 headline about bank bailouts was basically a protest against centralized financial trust, wasn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, that two thousand nine headline about bank bailouts was basically a protest against centralized financial trust, wasn't it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Buried within the code of his Genesis block, Nakamoto embedded a reminder of what happens when too much trust is placed in banks.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And now, uh, we've got bitcoin worth hundreds of thousands from those early 50-bitcoin mining rewards.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And now, uh, we've got bitcoin worth hundreds of thousands from those early fifty-bitcoin mining rewards.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The first full decade of digital currency without banks kicked off a year later, on January 1, 2010, with the mining of bitcoin block number 32620, which rewarded its miner with 50 bitcoin, then worth less than a single penny but now worth about $375,000.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But it wasn't all smooth sailing—remember Silk Road and the Mt. Gox hack? Those were massive setbacks.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But it wasn't all smooth sailing-remember Silk Road and the Mt. Gox hack? Those were massive setbacks.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The nascent technology has been plagued by infamous scandals like the FBIs shuttering of underground bitcoin-fueled drug and contraband marketplace Silk Road in 2013 and the $450 million hacking of cryptocurrency exchange Mt. Gox in 2014.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, for sure. The FBI taking down Silk Road in 2013 and that $450 million Mt. Gox theft really shook people's confidence.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, for sure. The F B I taking down Silk Road in twenty thirteen and that four hundred fifty dollars million Mt. Gox theft really shook people's confidence.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The nascent technology has been plagued by infamous scandals like the FBIs shuttering of underground bitcoin-fueled drug and contraband marketplace Silk Road in 2013 and the $450 million hacking of cryptocurrency exchange Mt. Gox in 2014.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And yet, here we are with companies like JPMorgan and IBM diving headfirst into blockchain. I mean, talk about irony.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And yet, here we are with companies like JPMorgan and I B M diving headfirst into blockchain. I mean, talk about irony.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In fact in a bit cruel irony, some of the most enthusiastic supporters and co-opters of blockchain technology today are those same big companies, ranging from IBM and Cargill to JPMorgan, that early bitcoin believers were rallying against.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, the very institutions bitcoin originally rallied against are now some of its biggest adopters. It's wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, the very institutions bitcoin originally rallied against are now some of its biggest adopters. It's wild.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Don't forget Laszlo Hanyecz—spending 10,000 bitcoin on pizza back in 2010. That's like burning a fortune today.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Don't forget Laszlo Hanyecz-spending ten thousand bitcoin on pizza back in twenty ten. That's like burning a fortune today.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: May 22, 2010 Programmer Laszlo Hanyecz buys two Papa Johns pizzas for $25 using 10,000 bitcoin, establishing its first market-based price: $0.0025

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Honestly, that story still hurts to think about. But it did set bitcoin's first real-world price.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Honestly, that story still hurts to think about. But it did set bitcoin's first real-world price.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: May 22, 2010 Programmer Laszlo Hanyecz buys two Papa Johns pizzas for $25 using 10,000 bitcoin, establishing its first market-based price: $0.0025

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And then Ripple came along in 2012, directly challenging traditional systems like Swift.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then Ripple came along in twenty twelve, directly challenging traditional systems like Swift.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: June 2012 Ripples XRP is born when co-founder Arthur Britto submits code limiting tokens to 100 billion. Ripple now competes with Swift.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and events like the Cypriot banking crisis in 2013 just fueled more interest—bitcoin jumped 40 percent almost overnight.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and events like the Cypriot banking crisis in twenty thirteen just fueled more interest-bitcoin jumped forty percent almost overnight.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: March 2013 Failing Cypriot banks threaten to seize deposits, triggering global interest in digital currency. Bitcoin soars 40% to $80.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Then Microsoft started accepting bitcoin in 2014, which was huge for mainstream adoption.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Then Microsoft started accepting bitcoin in twenty fourteen, which was huge for mainstream adoption.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: December 2014 Following Overstocks lead, Microsoft starts accepting bitcoin for Xbox games.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But the real game-changer might be Facebook's Libra announcement. It's forcing governments and banks to respond.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But the real game-changer might be Facebook's Libra announcement. It's forcing governments and banks to respond.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: June 18, 2019 Facebook announces libra, a cryptocurrency partially backed by dollars. China announces its own crypto.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. When China announced its own crypto right after, it felt like the digital currency war had officially begun.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. When China announced its own crypto right after, it felt like the digital currency war had officially begun.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: June 18, 2019 Facebook announces libra, a cryptocurrency partially backed by dollars. China announces its own crypto.
